title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient reports tolerating her splint without complaint but experiences hypersensitivity distal to the splint. On examination, the splint is in place with mild soft tissue swelling and significant hypersensitivity distal to it. The splint applies pressure, contributing to pain likely from mutaneous nerve irritation.
instruction: Summarize HPI with onset, duration, location, severity, and treatments.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: splint in place; mild soft tissue swelling; significant hypersensitivity distal to splint; unable to sublux extensor tendons; excellent PAP in splint.

title: Assessment
content:
- Hypersensitivity distal to splint
- Mutaneous nerve irritation

title: Plan
content:
- Modify splint
- Return to clinic if no improvement
- Follow-up in 3 weeks.
